title: Switchable Representation Learning Framework with Self-compatibility. (arXiv:2206.08289v4 [cs.AI] UPDATED)
abstract: Real-world visual search systems involve deployments on multiple platforms with different computing and storage resources. Deploying a unified model that suits the minimal-constrain platforms leads to limited accuracy. It is expected to deploy models with different capacities adapting to the resource constraints, which requires features extracted by these models to be aligned in the metric space. The method to achieve feature alignments is called ``compatible learning''. Existing research mainly focuses on the one-to-one compatible paradigm, which is limited in learning compatibility among multiple models. We propose a Switchable representation learning Framework with Self-Compatibility (SFSC). SFSC generates a series of compatible sub-models with different capacities through one training process. translated_abstract: 实际的实时视觉搜索系统涉及在多个平台上部署，这些平台具有不同的计算和存储资源。部署一个适用于最低限制平台的统一模型会导致精度受限。期望部署适应资源限制的不同容量的模型，这需要这些模型提取的特征在度量空间中对齐。实现特征对齐的方法被称为“兼容性学习”。现有研究主要集中在一对一的兼容范例上，这在多模型学习兼容性方面存在局限性。我们提出了一种具有自我兼容性的可切换表示学习框架（SFSC）。 SFSC通过一个训练过程生成一系列容量不同的相容子模型。子模型的优化面临梯度冲突问题，我们从幅度和方向的角度缓解了这个问题。我们动态调整子模型的优先级。
tldr: 该论文提出了一种可切换表示学习框架，具有自我兼容性，可以通过一个训练过程生成一系列容量不同的相容子模型。从幅度和方向的角度缓解了子模型优化时的梯度冲突问题。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a switchable representation learning framework with self-compatibility (SFSC), which generates a series of compatible sub-models with different capacities through one training process. The optimization of sub-models faces gradients conflict, which is mitigated by adjusting the priorities of sub-models dynamically from the perspective of the magnitude and direction.
